meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of an ecotype.
meanings.sent1: The plants in the ecotypic region have unique features.
meanings.sent2: The ecotypic characteristics of the animals help them survive in their habitat.
meanings.sent3: It's funny how the ecotypic birds always choose the same trees to build their nests.
meanings.sent4: Her ecotypic behavior in the workplace made her stand out among her colleagues.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypic traits of the fish make them perfectly suited for the cold waters.

meanings.definition: Of or pertaining to the ecological conditions of a specific habitat.
meanings.sent1: The ecotypic changes in the forest were noticeable after the storm.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the ecotypic factors that influence plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The ecotypic weather patterns in the desert can be quite extreme.
meanings.sent4: His ecotypic knowledge of the local flora helped him identify rare species.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypic variations in soil composition affect the types of plants that can grow there.

meanings.definition: Showing adaptation to a particular environment.
meanings.sent1: The ecotypic animals have evolved unique survival strategies.
meanings.sent2: Plants with ecotypic traits can thrive in harsh conditions.
meanings.sent3: It's amusing to see how the ecotypic insects camouflage themselves in the environment.
meanings.sent4: Her ecotypic skills in foraging impressed the group during the camping trip.
meanings.sent5: The ecotypic changes in the bird's plumage helped it blend in with its surroundings.
